title: THEA-Code: an Autoencoder-Based IDS-correcting Code for DNA Storage
authors: Alan J.X. Guo, Mengyi Wei, Yufan Dai, Yali Wei, Pengchen Zhang
abstract:
The insertion, deletion, substitution (IDS) correcting code has garnered
increased attention due to significant advancements in DNA storage that emerged
recently. Despite this, the pursuit of optimal solutions in IDS-correcting
codes remains an open challenge, drawing interest from both theoretical and
engineering perspectives. This work introduces a pioneering approach named
THEA-code. The proposed method follows a heuristic idea of employing an
end-to-end autoencoder for the integrated encoding and decoding processes. To
address the challenges associated with deploying an autoencoder as an
IDS-correcting code, we propose innovative techniques, including the
differentiable IDS channel, the entropy constraint on the codeword, and the
auxiliary reconstruction of the source sequence. These strategies contribute to
the successful convergence of the autoencoder, resulting in a deep
learning-based IDS-correcting code with commendable performance. Notably,
THEA-Code represents the first instance of a deep learning-based code that is
independent of conventional coding frameworks in the IDS-correcting domain.
Comprehensive experiments, including an ablation study, provide a detailed
analysis and affirm the effectiveness of THEA-Code.
